etymology.interpretation: 人 supplies the sound rén, while 二 adds the idea of “two,” often read as the bond between people that grounds benevolence. By phonetic extension, the graph also came to write the homophonous sense “kernel.”

examples.chinese: 他待人仁慈(他待人仁慈)，乐于助人(樂於助人)。
examples.english: He treats others with benevolence and is eager to help.

examples.chinese: 儒家强调“仁义”(儒家強調「仁義」)，以爱人为本(以愛人為本)。
examples.pinyin: Rújiā qiángdiào “rényì”, yǐ àirén wéi běn.
examples.english: Confucianism emphasizes “benevolence and righteousness,” taking love for others as foundational.

examples.chinese: 核桃仁很香(核桃仁很香)，可以入菜(可以入菜)。
examples.pinyin: Hétáo rén hěn xiāng, kěyǐ rù cài.
examples.english: Walnut kernels are very fragrant and can be used in cooking.
